instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PM_EN_P3V3_G3H: What is PM_EN_P3V3_G3H? PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is a signal that enables the PP3V3_G3H rail to turn on. This comes out of ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip; when missing, often is missing because of a bad ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Draws 5.17v no current 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> not present 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> not present 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL>
Diode mode readings 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=0.353
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>=0.373
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL>=0.340

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Any history available?
Do you get 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
If yes, post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>EN_VR1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>*, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.message:
Is that voltage reading?
Please, post accurate information.
We don't want "V" posted for diode mode readings, but is mandatory for voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>=0.505v"
Are you sure about this?
May have bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>=3.341v"
Then this is not possible!

Check <RESISTOR>R7015</RESISTOR>/16 and traces.
If both good, change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
